thread.title: Martin Kaymer makes ideal start at Vilamoura
thread.title_full: Martin Kaymer makes ideal start at Vilamoura

title: Martin Kaymer makes ideal start at Vilamoura
text:
Martin Kaymer makes ideal start at Vilamoura 15 Oct 2015 09:46:57 
comments 
Pre-tournament favourite Martin Kaymer made the ideal start when the Portugal Masters got under way at Vilamoura on Thursday. 
The start of play was delayed by 55 minutes due to fog, but two-time major winner Kaymer quickly made up for lost time with birdies on the 10th and 11th - his first two holes - at Oceanico Victoria Golf Club. 
At two under par, Kaymer was one off the early pace being set by Ireland's Paul Dunne, Nicolas Colsaerts and Trevor Fisher, with Dunne continuing to impress in the paid ranks after turning professional following Great Britain and Ireland's Walker Cup win in September. 
The 22-year-old, who was 19th in the Dunhill Links Championship and 25th in the British Masters last week, also started on the back nine and holed his approach to the 10th for an eagle before adding a birdie on the 11th. 
Former Ryder Cup player Colsaerts had birdied the 11th, 12th and 13th as he looked to go one better than last year, when he finished second to France's Alexander Levy in a tournament reduced to 36 holes due to torrential rain. 
Colsaerts narrowly missed a birdie putt on the final hole of his opening round 12 months ago to card the first 59 in European Tour history, with Levy carding rounds of 63 and 61 to win on 18 under par. Related Sport News
